title: != not specified for complex values
body:
The "Comparison operators" section of the specification states that two
complex values are equal if their real and imag parts are equal, but it does not state
when they are not equal.  I assume it is:

(real(u) != real(v) || imag(u) != imag(v))

...which is of course not the same as !(u == v) for NaNs.
